skillTree.localised_description: The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.

ui_effects.localised_text: ➕ Explosion does not affect friendly troops
➕ Activates automatically when conditions are met

skillTree.localised_description: A reward for utter dedication to the Warrior-Queen, every swipe of its sandstone tail can carve through mortal flesh.

ui_effects.localised_text: ➕ Explosion does not affect friendly troops
➕ Activates automatically when conditions are met

skillTree.localised_description: The pain of immortal misery, coupled with insane violence, characterises the return to Unlife for many of the Tomb Kings, who fight longer, harder and better than they ever could before.
You cannot build an empire without sacrificing a few sons…
The fluid used to embalm the Tomb King toughens his bindings, enabling him to withstand a greater degree of damage than would otherwise be possible.
Soaked in and toughened by embalming fluid, the cloth bindings used to mummify afford the wearer additional protection from all but a direct hit from mortal projectiles.

skillTree.localised_name: Asaph the Goddess of Magic & Vengeance
skillTree.localised_description: They who serve the Asp Goddess are blessed with a precise aim with which to reach their objectives.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +12% for Skeleton Archers and Sepulchral Stalkers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Whenever Khalida awakens, the power of the Asp Goddess floods her body, infusing life and power into her mummified remains so that she may defeat her enemies.
Saved from the Blood Kiss at the hands of her cousin Neferata, Khalida was cleansed of evil by the Goddess of Beauty and Vengeance.

effects.description:
Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The magnificent tomb city is renowned for its Undead archers, pledged to serve the High Queen for eternity.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +3 for Skeleton Archer units

Ammunition: +25% for Skeleton Archers units
	(all armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: Those pledged to fight for Asaph also worship Khalida, her physical embodiment in full, furious Unlife.
The venom running through Khalida's veins enables her to move with the speed of a striking asp.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Sepulchral Stalkers and Necropolis Knights units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Sepulchral Stalkers and Necropolis Knights units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Her legendary intelligence, temperament and personal bravery make Khalida stand out, even from the extraordinary ranks of the immortal Tomb Kings.
It is not possible to defeat such unshakeable spirit once its owner's mind is made up.
Every move is perfectly choreographed, as if it were a dance… a dance of death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
He whose will transcends death can strike out from beyond the grave, to devastating effect.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Death is not an impedance to the strongest of wills.
Beware the scorpion's sting, hidden 'neath the desert sands yet always poised to strike.
The promise of a glorious afterlife worthy of a courageous warrior keeps embattled troops focused on the grim task at hand.
Carrying the blessing of the goddess Asaph, these arrows seek out the foe with unerring accuracy.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +8% for Skeleton Archers, Screaming Skull Catapult and Bone Giant units

skillTree.localised_description: Death isn't necessarily the end; those who have pledged service must rise to fight again another day.

skillTree.localised_description: Formed by long campaigns and bloody slaughter in the stifling desert heat, the bond between steed and rider cannot be broken, even when death tries to intervene.

skillTree.localised_description: "The swift charioteers of the king. They who pursue the sovereign's foes on the day of his awakening."

skillTree.localised_description: Simple stone is afforded more respect than other materials, for from its grain giant guardians are hewn, brought to shuddering life by the Liche Priests' sorcery.

skillTree.localised_description: Not even stone is set in stone it seems – arcane death magic is used to bring tortured, savage vigour to once-dormant stone sentinels.

skillTree.localised_description: It takes an iron will and unnatural - supernatural - strength to rally bound troops routed by magical means.
Arrows loosed under the ever-watchful eye of the Serpent Goddess find their marks with divine precision.

skillTree.localised_description: The desert itself is his steed.

skillTree.localised_description: A dream of glory attained through conquest great rages still, despite the dying of the light.

skillTree.localised_description: The very strength of the desert, to stand sentinel over the Tomb Kings' domain and crush their enemies to dust.

skillTree.localised_description: Dark litanies are uttered to restore the Tomb Kings' slain soldiers to a twisted, chattering imitation of life.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Some of war's spoils are more difficult to see but are just as valuable as gold or jewels.
This one scours the battlefields, plains and dunes for the vanquished dead, so that his armies may march at full strength once more.
These jars contain the remains of many Liche Priests, which are useful for raising and binding a new force.
Nehekhara's mummified rulers are awake, their eyes burning with balefire, their thirst for power, conquest and vengeance every bit as strong as they were in life.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: By which the Undead armies of Nehekhara may remain deathless, undying and forever hungry for slaughter.

effects.description:
Attrition: -15% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -35% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To the victor, the spoils. All of them. Always.
It stands watch over the land, lest the foe's insidious, opportunistic agents dare to strike.
Renowned among their allies and feared by enemies both mortal and otherwise, this Lord's every deed adds to their already legendary reputation.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: As the embodiment of the Asp Goddess in full fury, a wave of pure terror rolls over those who look upon her.

items.colour_text: Fashioned into the shape of a striking asp, the staff writhes and spits with the spiteful anger of Asaph, Goddess of Vengeance.
